author: cheechyuan.eth
content:
Hi, in https://github.com/ethereum/kzg-ceremony-specs/blob/master/docs/participant/participant.md#signing-the-contributions

```
eth_address_to_identity(identity).encode()
github_handle_to_identity(identity).encode()
```

maybe im missing something but i cant seem to find out how the eth address and github handle is converted to identity. could someone help me out on this?

author: mikesnewname
content: Hi guys i completed the KZG ceremony about 2 weeks ago or more, but cant find my contribution on the page now.

author: mikesnewname
content: Yeah its not showing there

author: mikesnewname
content: Heres the record. But when i put in my ethereum address its not there

author: pietjepuk
content: I think you pressed the "unlock with Github" button, not the "Unlock with Ethereum" button. Otherwise you Participant ID would've shown an address no?

author: mikesnewname
content: damnit.. damn!!!!

author: mikesnewname
content: would it work in the same way, would it be seen as attached to my eth address to?

author: pietjepuk
content: If you go through the process again, but this time used an Ethereum address, there's nothing linking your two contributions

author: pietjepuk
content: unless you use something like `mikew2479.eth` of course

author: mikesnewname
content: as in alot of protocols are using it to register multipliers for airdrops

author: mikesnewname
content: nope ðŸ˜¦

author: mikesnewname
content: Are you sure if you mint on github its not traceable to your mainnet pass?

author: bridge-bot
content: <CarlBeek> nope, nothing linking your github and ethereum addresses. if you really want a POAP at the end, you'll need to contribute with an eth addy

author: mikesnewname
content: Damn ok. Wish they didnt have the github option

author: bridge-bot
content: <CarlBeek> this is why we deemphasized the GitHub option on ceremony.ethereum.org

content: interesting. which ones have you heard of using it for airdrops?

author: trent_vanepps
content: the first open contribution period is open until March 13, then Special period (for grants), then again for Open contribution until 4844 is ready to go live

author: mikesnewname
content: Thank you! i've left my computer running it hopefully it works

author: mikesnewname
content: Should i just leave it running continuously or should stop and try every couple of hours, what is the best method?

author: pietjepuk
content: Run it when you would've been online anyway

author: pietjepuk
content: Don't leave your PC running just to stay in the lobby. Just wake up the next day and log in again.
